headline: 'Donald Trump' and 'Kim Jong Un' trade jabs on 'Watters' World'
subHeadline: Guests: Mike Huckabee; Herman Cain; Cathy Areu, Corey Lewandowski; Jason Chaffetz

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Welcome to "Watters World." I'm Jesse Watters. The lying rat falls flat. That's the subject of tonight's "Watters's Words." Trump's old lawyer, Michael Cohen, convicted liar and tax cheat about to head to prison for three years. But before leaving, he became the Democrat star witness in stage one of their impeachment proceedings. Here is Cohen in his own words.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL COHEN, FORMER PERSONAL ATTORNEY TO DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I have lied, but I'm not a liar, and I have done bad things, but I am not a bad man.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sure you're not. Now, the media won't tell you this, but Cohen systematically destroyed about a dozen left wing talking points. Let's begin. Under oath, Cohen helped puncture Russian collusion and obstruction narratives.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Questions have been raised about whether I know of direct evidence that Mr. Trump or his campaign colluded with Russia. I do not. And I want to be clear, Mr. Trump did not directly tell me to lie to Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: By the way, if Cohen did have the goods on the President, Mueller would have cut a deal with him and he wouldn't be facing any prison time at all. He obviously has nothing. Next, he drove a stake through the heart of the Clinton finance dossier. The centerpiece of the dossier was that Trump sent Cohen to Prague to hatch the collusion caper with the Russians. Now, that's a lie.

utterances.speaker: REP. RALPH NORMAN, R-S.C.
utterances.sentences: Have you ever been to Prague?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I have never been to Prague.

utterances.speaker: NORMAN
utterances.sentences: Never have?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I've never been to Czech Republic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In addition, Cohen said he had no evidence that Trump directed Roger Stone to make contacts with WikiLeaks.

utterances.speaker: REP. DEBBIE WASSERMAN SCHULTZ, D-FLA
utterances.sentences: Do you have reason to believe that the President explicitly or implicitly authorized Mr. Stone to make contact with WikiLeaks and to indicate the campaign's interest in the strategic release of these illegally hacked materials.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I am not aware of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So Cohen also said that Stone told Trump in July 2016 that WikiLeaks was about to drop all of these dirt on the Democrats. Now Cohen claims Stone had advanced knowledge, but in fact Stone knew just about the same time as everybody else knew because Julian Assange posted on Twitter that he was about to drop something. So there's nothing there.   Speaking of nothing there, Cohen destroyed the campaign finance violation allegation against Donald Trump. Remember Stormy Daniels was paid for her so-called story in the fall of 2016? Now these things happen when you're as rich and famous as Donald Trump is. You pay for negative allegations to go away to protect your personal and family reputation. Trump would have the "National Enquirer" President David Pecker buy the rights to the other party's stories catching them and killing them.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I was involved in several of these catch and kill episodes, but these catch and kill scenarios existed between David Pecker and Mr. Trump long before I started working for him in 2007.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now this is critical. Trump had been doing this for over a decade, therefore, the Stormy payment was not a campaign expenditure. It was a personal expenditure, not a crime because Trump had been doing this for years and would have done it regardless of the campaign. I should be a lawyer, shouldn't I?   Cohen also says he has no evidence of Trump ever using the N-word.

utterances.speaker: REP. MARK MEADOWS, R-N.C.
utterances.sentences: I've talked to the President over 300 times, I've not heard one time a racist comment out of his mouth in private, so how do you reconcile it? Do you have proof of those conversations?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I would ask you to ask --

utterances.speaker: MEADOWS
utterances.sentences: Do you have tape recordings of those conversations?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Cohen continued to knock down left-wing anti-Trump conspiracy theories.

utterances.speaker: REP. RAJA KRISHNAMOORTHI, D-ILL.
utterances.sentences: Do you have any knowledge of President Trump arranging any healthcare procedures for any women not in his family?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'm not aware of that, no.

utterances.speaker: REP. JACKIE SPEIER, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: Is there a love child?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: There is not to the best of my knowledge.

utterances.speaker: REP. HARLEY ROUDA, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: In addition to convicted Russian mobster Sater do you know of any other ties to convicted or alleged mobsters President Trump may have?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'm not aware.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So Trump has never paid for an abortion, never had a love child and never had any mob ties. Got it. Thanks, Michael. It's pretty clear, this is a revenge plot by the Clintons to bloody up Trump for 2020. Now see the guy behind Cohen right, there Lanny Davis. The Clinton fixer is now representing Trump's old fixer. The fix is in. Lanny is probably still getting paid by the Clintons or some fat-cat Democrat donor. Cohen and Lanny colluded with Adam Schiff before the hearing and have been leaking to the media like crazy. Now, remember, the Democrats started this hit job with a dossier, then the wiretaps and then the witch hunt. Cohen is being used and the millions of people who voted for Donald Trump are being abused.   Here with reaction, former Arkansas governor and Fox News contributor Mike Huckabee and CEO of the New Voice, Herman Cain. Mr. Cain, I'll begin with you today.

utterances.speaker: HERMAN CAIN, CEO, NEW VOICE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did you think of my "Watters' Words"?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: You could be an attorney, but stick with your day job, okay. You're must better you must better with your day job.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you. I would agree.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: Look, lack of credibility. Pure and simple. Every time the Democrats think they've got a "gotcha" point on President Trump, there's no there, there. What's even sadder, Jesse, is that they continue to spew the same narrative no matter what.  They are trying to drive the perception to this President which is totally different from the results that he's generating and this was just another example. The Democrats want to try to embarrass this President at all cost. Why else would they hold this hearing at the same time that President Trump is trying to denuclearize the peninsula of Korea and bring world peace? They don't care about any results, they only care about trying to bring down Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, they want to - they don't want protection from Kim, they want protection from a second Trump turn, Governor Huckabee.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, it's just a coincidence that the hearing was on the same day as the Summit, right?

utterances.speaker: MIKE HUCKABEE, R-ARK., FORMER GOVERNOR
utterances.sentences: Total coincidence, Jesse. They had no idea that it would end up like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Look, you know, the thing that's amazing, the Democrats have run out of cheese for this rat to come and eat and the sad thing is, every time he answered a question, he answered a question that did more to help Donald Trump than to hurt him. One of the first rules a good attorney knows, you never ask a question in open court that you don't already know the answer to. These were guys who really were committing one of the most egregious freshman errors ever in asking questions that they thought were going to be incriminating and it turns out, it was quite the opposite and it was anything but incriminating. It's freedom of --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're right. It's so funny, the look on their faces when they realized, "Wait, wait. No lovechild. Wait, no mob ties. Wait can you say that again?" It was definitely fun to watch.  I want to take us to now Kamala Harris who I think is trying to -- she's "The Anointed One." The media loves her. She's probably going to get the nomination. She has gone so far left. Listen to what she says about prostitution. Roll it.

utterances.speaker: TERRELL JERMAINE STARR, SENIOR REPORTER, THE ROOT
utterances.sentences: Do you think that sex work ought to be decriminalized?

utterances.speaker: REP. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: I think so. I do. When you're talking about consenting adults, I think that, you know, yes. We should really consider that we can't criminalize consensual behavior.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So Mr. Cain, legalizing prostitution. The Democratic ticket that's the platform, I guess, right?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: It's one of them, I guess, in her case. Look, Kamala Harris from the very time she announced that she was a Democratic Presidential wannabe has taken pandering to a whole new level. She's acting quite frankly kind of like Hillary Clinton did. Whatever she needs to say about whatever hot issue comes up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're right.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: She's going to agree with it and pander to them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're right.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: And I don't think she's going to be a shoo-in for the nomination because she has contradicted herself. She's gone too far to the flaming left and I wrote a book about 14 years ago, Jesse, it was entitled, "They Think We're Stupid." No we're not. Maybe some of her supporters are stupid, but most of the American people are not stupid and she is assuming that they are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Maybe you are right. Maybe she goes so far to the flaming left she gets burned and can never recover and can never ever tack back into the center if she gets the nomination because now she's on the record like Mr. Cain said, I mean she asked these questions, she says, sure. The other day, someone asked, do you think you should get rid of Columbus Day and replace it with Indigenous Peoples Day and she said, sure, that's a great idea. I mean, she's killing herself, Governor.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Yes, well the thing that Kamala Harris has done is you know, it's like when I was little, my sister had a doll called Chatty Cathy. You'd pull the string and it would say stuff.  I mean, I think Kamala Harris is now, pull the string and she'll say anything and now we know that her basic platform is, she's for unrestricted abortion, open borders, for legalized pot and prostitution and you know, she wants to defy and get rid of I.C.E. and she goes through all these things and you're thinking, "I'm not sure if she wants to be President or if she wants to be a Professor at Berkeley."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. That wasn't your doll, you're just saying that was your sister's. It was definitely your sister's.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: I want to make that's very, very clear, it was my sister's, yes. This was long before the day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also, okay, I am glad we cleared that up. Also, Kamala really going hard after the President said some pretty vicious things. Let's listen to that.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: You call bigotry what it is, you call racism what it is, you call violence what it is.

utterances.speaker: STARR
utterances.sentences: Is President Trump a racist?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Well, look when you talk about his statement on that, when you talk about him calling African countries S-hole countries, when you talk about him referring to immigrants as rapists and murderers, I don't think you can reach any other conclusion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now, Herman, this really bothers me because if she does get the nomination, she's going to have to on the debate stage walk up to the President, shake his hand and exchange pleasantries. If she thinks he is a racist, how is she going to do that?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: She is going to try and backpedal and she's going to try and blur the issue. Every time she or anyone else calls the President a racist, they are basically trying to feed what I call the perception of this President without looking at the reality. Let me just sum it up this way. I know President Trump. If he is a racist, then I'm white and Governor Huckabee is black. Now you try to rationalize that. That's how much I feel he is not a racist, okay. Mike -- Governor Huckabee is still white and I'm still black. But if he is a racist, we're going to switch colors.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The governor has got a great tan that I don't think that makes him black.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Hey, Jesse, here's a question for you. When did Donald Trump become a racist? I mean, for decades, he was the toast of town in the most diverse city in the entire world, New York City. Everyone wanted their picture made with him. They all wanted to hang out with him. So when did he become a racist? The man is 72 years old. Most people don't suddenly change their entire life long philosophy at the age of 72. I'd like for someone to tell me the moment in time at which he suddenly switched from being this guy that every one of every race loved and wanted to hang out with to being a racist, tell me when that happened, and if you can't, you really don't have anything to pin on him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think in the Democrats' mind, it happened when he came down the escalator that summer 2015. Let's get from black and white to green. The Green New Deal according to the number crunchers will cost, are you ready? Almost a hundred million -- no, no, no billion -- no, no, no trillion dollars. Ninety three trillion dollars. Now Herman Cain, the 999 Plan can't even get that much revenue.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: No. That number that they estimate the Green New Deal is going to cost is 4.5 times or more the size of our Gross Domestic Product. It does not make any sense. Remember the book I wrote, they think we're stupid, and they must have a lot of stupid supporters out there who are getting all excited about this Green New Deal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they don't care Governor how much it costs, they just say, "You know what? It's an investment." That's the new lingo. It's an investment.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Well and why would we care? I mean, after 12 years, we're all going to be burned up anyway, so it really won't matter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true. Yes, we'll all be dead.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Here's my question. If they need to cover that $93 trillion, I'm going to just go ahead and be generous. I'm going to write them a check. Now, I won't be able to cover the whole amount, but I'm going to put something on it and I'm going to post-date the check for 12 years from now, just in case they need it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very smart.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: I have one other request, Jesse, when we go bankrupt and the planet burns up, can I please have a hamburger that won't be around that Ocasio- Cortez says that we need to get rid of? Let me go out with a hamburger in my hand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, she just got photographed eating -- she just got photographed eating a hamburger somewhere.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ashe was embarrassed about it because, I guess, according to the Green New Deal, you've got to get rid of the cows, you know, we've got to go green.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If you get the hamburger, give me a rib eye and some bacon- wrapped shrimp. I'll take that any day over the burger.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Man, you're killing the earth, Governor. You are killing the earth with all of that bacon and the steak. Lastly and this is just on a more serious note, but I think it's important to cover. Earlier this week, they had a vote in the Senate on banning partial birth abortions. Some people call it infanticide, you deliver the baby and the baby is terminated on the table. No coverage at all. Look at Tuesday's coverage, the networks totally spikes this thing. Zero minutes from ABC, zero from CBS, zero from NBC. This was a vote the Democrats were against and they're all on record as supporting now partial birth abortion and the mainstream media ran a protection ring around them. Governor, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Well this is worse than infanticide. I mean, this is actually murder of a child that has already been delivered and that's what I think a lot of people don't understand and one of the senators said, "Well, the reason I didn't vote for it was because it offends women's reproductive health."  Look, at this point, the woman has already reproduced. The baby is out of her womb. It's no longer a part of her. It's not an abortion. This is a child laying on a table 15 feet from her and instead of the doctor doing what he can to save this attempted abortion of a baby, he actually goes in and actively kills the baby after it's been born alive. And when Democrats can't vote for something that would protect a crying baby, then they are party of the Canaanites of ancient days and they ought to be turned away forever. Just disgusting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Mr. Cain, 53-44 in the Senate, it looks like a few abstained, but party line votes, pretty sad day in America for that.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: It's a pretty sad day. I agree with Governor Huckabee. It's murder, pure and simple, and if you ever wondered not that we wonder that the media outlets that you named were not entertained with Democrats, there's no clearer evidence than them not reporting on the murder of babies. It's pure and clear and clear as crystal day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, gentlemen, thanks for joining "Watters World," and we'll see you guys, soon.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Thanks, great to be with you.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Up next, a woman calls the police because a dog humps her dog at a dog park. I am not kidding. Wait until you see it. And later, Donald Trump and Kim Jong-un patched things up after the Second Summit, the notorious impersonators will be here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden flirting with the idea of running for President in 2020 saying he plans to make an announcement soon, but is Biden already caving to the resistance? He recently said this about Vice President Pence.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: The fact of the matter is, it was followed on by a guy - he's a decent guy, our Vice President.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just hours later, he backtracked tweeting this, "There is nothing decent about being anti-LGBTQ rights and that includes the Vice President."  Joining me now, political columnist, Cathy Areu and former Trump campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski. Ladies first, I'm sorry, Corey. Cathy, can't Biden just say he's a decent guy and just let it go? Why does he have to pander and cater because some nitwit radical resister on Twitter gives him a hard time?

utterances.speaker: CATHY AREU, POLITICAL COLUMNIST
utterances.sentences: He did not have to apologize but he did because that person represented a community, the LGBT community and he wants those voters, so if he wants those voter --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: LGBTQ. Do not forget the Q.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: Q I A, so actually, there's like -- it's usually LGBTQ plus, so there's many ways to do it. I don't want to offend, but yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Corey is very offended.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: So we offended them. Yes, he offended members of that group, not everyone, so it can't be said that Democrats are insane. There are certain people that were offended and they have the right to be offended.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I understand that, but Corey, Biden has done this before. Remember, he's like, "I'm going to take President Trump behind the schoolhouse and knock him out," and then he had to apologize 24 hours later, "You know, I shouldn't have used such violent rhetoric."  I mean, just own it. I mean, right? Isn't that what people want?

utterances.speaker: COREY LEWANDOWSKI, FORMER TRUMP CAMPAIGN MANAGER
utterances.sentences: Look, Jesse, you know what people love about Trump? It is he is a fighter. They fight for him. What people are so sick and tired of is the political correctness that all of these people think they have to please everybody and so they please nobody. To go and say something bad about Vice President Mike Pence is actually insane because I say it all the time, he's too nice of a person to be in politics. I mean, that's how great Mike Pence is. He is the nicest human being and the nicest family and the religious values that he holds dear should be celebrated and not chastised.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean he like won't even be in the room without his wife there if there's another woman. I mean, the guy is as pure as the wind- driven snow just like you, Corey.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Jesse, they say that about us a lot.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: You and I have the same thing that they say about us, just so you know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We have so much in common. So much in common.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I want to move to Beto, he's also considering getting in, Cathy. I used to think Beto had a real shot at this and now, I think is weird. He went on some sort of poetry tour in a bus like Kerouac and started writing dark strange things about finding himself. I don't really get that. He moves his hands around a lot like he's on speed. Break him down for us.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: Break him down? Well, I think he went to a Metallica concert after he announced that he was going to run for President, but he energizes the base. People like him. So he has a shot. He really does have a shot according to many sources. They believe he might be a little --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean he does poll well, Corey if you look at some of the polls, he's like top three or four in most of them.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Jesse, the real deal is, is the guy's first name is Robert, so I think, he's offended the Irish Catholic vote which is Robert O'Rourke is who this guy's real name is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh there goes the Irish vote.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: So if I am offended -- I am offended because I'm part Irish that he won't represent us as he runs for office. His name is Robert O'Rourke. That's like calling me Juan Lewandowski. That is not his name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Can you explain how you get from Robert at Beto? I don't even get that.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: No, it doesn't -- look, it doesn't exist. My mother gave me the name Corey. She didn't give me Juan. I'm part Irish. He has offended every Irish Catholic out there by changing his name to Beto.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I guess Beto is short for Robert, if you -- I don't know. We're going to give him a pass because maybe it's an El Paso thing. Let's go and talk about something that really grabs my attention, so there's this woman at a dog park and she's got her dog there and there's other dogs around. Some other dog starts humping her dog. She calls the cops, why?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why are you calling the cops right now? Because I told you I wasn't leaving the park? Because my dog was humping your dog? I'm not verbally assaulting you. I told you I'm not leaving. Look at that assault, guys. Oh my God, he's assaulting my dog. Let me call the cops. I love when you can call the cops on people just because a dog humped your dog. No, you know what it is? Because I'm black so she decided to call the cops real first. Let me call the cops. I bet if I was white you wouldn't have called the cops.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And the race card got thrown in there at the end. Cathy, this culture is going down the tubes, calling the police because a dog gets a little frisky in the park? Come on. You're not going to defend this woman, are you?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: I'm not going defend her even though dog parks do have rules and I don't think humping is one of the rules.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, do they say that?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: So he did - the dog dig break a rule.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like no humping at the dog park sign?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, some people consider that. You can't have aggressive dogs at a dog park. There are dog park rules, so his dog was perhaps breaking a rule and the police said no call is too small. So apparently people always call 911. Not always, but a lot of people call 911. They're used to it, so if she wanted to call, that was her right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean getting a cat out of a tree is more of an important idea than this, Corey, I mean aggressive because he got a little playful?

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Look, maybe the dog was happy about it. Maybe she should get a different pet. Maybe she should an Imgur giraffe that can't be mounted the same way. This is insanity. Talk about a waste of valuable resources taking the police to come because their dog had some action. Their dog is begging for the action.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's real crimes out there. There's real crimes.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: The dog had a sign, "open for business." It's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you need consent now in order for dogs to get together. Lastly, also this culture is getting a little interesting. I've never seen anything like this before. You have transgendered women running against kind of people that were born as women and they're smoking them because they have testosterone and people are getting upset about this and now, also we have women want to be in the same wrestling divisions as men and men are saying, "Are you kidding me?" Listen to this guy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I just don't think that's really appropriate with a young lady and it's also so aggressive and just -- that's not -- I'm not really, I guess comfortable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, so what's the move Cathy? If a girl wants to wrestle a boy in high school, that's okay?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.sentences: Well yes, Title IX says it's okay, so Title IX allows anyone from any gender, sex to play in sports, so to participate. So yes. This is actually allowed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, here's my opinion, Corey, this is what I would do. I would bail out of the match not because I think it's wrong, I'd be afraid to lose to the girl and then I'd never live that down.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Well, Jesse, I understand what your high school career was like, yes, I understand that, but look, Title IX is about equity. It means the women should have the same opportunities as the men do in equal playing field. If they want to play one sport, they play the same way. That doesn't mean there's inter-party, you know, men play the women and the women play the men at the same time, Title IX was designed so that women's sporting engagements had the same funding level. The same facilities.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know what they need? Guys, they need Title IX at the dog park. That'll solve all problems.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's what happened.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Corey, Cathy, thank you guys.

utterances.speaker: LEWANDOWSKI

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very much. All right, Cory Booker humiliates himself and AOC starts a Civil War in the Democratic Party, that's next.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. The Sacramento District Attorney announcing today that two Sacramento police officers who shot and killed an unarmed black man last year will not face criminal charges. A major winter storm bringing heavy snow from California all the way to New England this weekend creating travel delays and flight cancellations. Some areas getting up to a foot of snow and more winter weather is on the way. Another storm is moving across the country right now, set to bring heavy snow and rain. The worst of it, expected in the northeast regions Sunday night into Monday morning. I am Aishah Hasnie, now back to "Watters' World."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Democrats have been warning that Trump will spark a Civil War in America. But it looks like he sparks one in the Democratic Party. utterances.sentences: She did. She voted against her party. The only one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: She better check that list twice because she is on the primary list that she created.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now, think about what the actual vote was about? So if illegal aliens scurries across the southern border, then they try to buy a weapon, they want -- Republicans for I.C.E. to be contacted. Okay, normal rational, okay.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

She wants to expand background checks for citizens, but not for illegals.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: So remember that bill I told you she did vote with the Republicans for? utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, that's too mean. It's too mean. They can buy explosives, weapons -- just don't tell anybody.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Put them on a list and let's primary them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's just put them on a list. Speaking of a list of ingredients that Booker does not know anything about. We know he's a vegan. I did not know he doesn't drink alcohol either. I don't believe you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, so you know exactly what Booker is going through. He was about how to mix some drinks, roll it. SAEED JONES, HOST, AM2DM, BUZZFEED: What is in a Manhattan?

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J.
utterances.sentences: Wow, I mean, it's from New York. Manhattan, I have little -- I guess I'm going to be -- I am going to live to regret this lack of knowledge. utterances.speaker: JONES

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: I didn't know that it's not vodka.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you don't -- you're worse than booker.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: The only thing I know about margarita, isn't that the one they put the salt on it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Okay, so ...

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So listen, you don't drink alcohol, give Cory Booker some advice. As a politician who doesn't drink alcohol, tell him how to handle these things because he's watching.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: You know he's watching. He always watches "Watters' World." He's always watching "Watters' World." Go with rum and coke. If you don't know the ingredients of rum and coke, then it's time to hang it up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Great advice, Congressman.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much. All right, the left blames stress for the Smollett hoax. That's right. They're blaming stress. Diamond and Silk are in the studio to blow off some steam about that and later, Donald Trump and little rocket man impersonators join me

utterances.speaker: BRYTON TURNER, ATTACKED FOR WEARING A MAGA HAT

utterances.sentences: Absolutely. And you know, that should be considered a hate crime.

utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Do not touch --

utterances.sentences: Don't interrupt dinner.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Don't first of all, don't do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a hate crime.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: That's a food crime.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: But some legislation needs to be put in place because this is going too far.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: People just -- they think that they can take off your hat or punch you in the face. It's an absolute no-no. And that should be considered the real hate crime.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: And for God's sake, if you take off my hat, don't take off my wig, too because it's going down.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't mess with the hair.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Don't mess with the hair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, a political hate crime. That's what we'll call it.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: That's exactly what it is.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, also in the mix right now, you have people in the media, the Hollywood reporter actually said that stress caused Jussie Smollett to create this hoax fake crime. He couldn't handle the pressure of Hollywood, so then he just framed 60 million Trump voters. Can you believe the media?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Well, see, what they are trying to do is normalize his behavior, but it's not going to work. Listen, the book needs to be thrown at him and he need to be prosecuted to the full extent of the law. Because that could have ripped our country apart.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Lock him up.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Lock him up. That's right.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: Right, lock him all up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You guys are doing to do the chant?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND AND SILK
utterances.sentences: Lock him up. Lock him up.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: Clink, clink.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, throw the cuffs on him. Also, AOC -- now, she has said a lot of strange things so far and it's only been a few months, but this is one of the strangest because the environment is going to hell in a hands basket and we are all going to die in 12 years, she recommends or suggests maybe we shouldn't have kids because kids have an impact on the climate. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: Our planet is going to be a disaster if we don't turn this ship around. And so it is basically like there is scientific consensus that the lives of children are going to be very difficult. And it does lead, I think, young people to have a legitimate question, you know, should -- is it okay to still have children?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow, she is against hamburgers and babies.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Yes, see, her ideas that she is proposing is going to be stressful on the lives of our children if she don't stop it. Another thing, what if her mother would say, maybe we shouldn't have children and they didn't have her. So there are some of the things that she says is - to me, it's ignorant, and sometimes, she just needs to be quiet if she doesn't have anything good to say. And that maybe why she is "hip-hip-hooray" for a party that's okay with killing babies.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: With killing babies.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: When they come from the wombs, you can go ahead and kill them.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: That explains a whole lot.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It sure does, doesn't it?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now, Michael Cohen came out and testified hours and hours this week. I know you guys are fired up about that. He's a rat. I mean --

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: He is a liar.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: He is a liar.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He is facing three years in prison, a rat and a liar. What did you think about the spectacle?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Listen, first of all, Congress should - they need to be ashamed of themselves.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Congress has no shame.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They don't feel ashamed in Congress.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: But see, they did this to try to embarrass our President. Another thing is, Michael Cohen is a liar. We have known him since 2015 and I don't know who that is in front of Congress because that's not the man we know.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: And what my President do with his money is his business. What Congress do with taxpayer dollars -- that is our business.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: And that's what they should be up there talking about.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, now, I want to talk about money. Because I have been wanting to talk to you guys about this for quite some time.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I am taking credit for discovering Diamond and Silk because I brought Diamond and Silk on to "Watters' World" and then they blew up. Now, Diamond and Silk are at CPAC, they are on tour, they are running the world. I want to know, ladies, where is my finder's fee?

utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.sentences: Thank you for having us.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.sentences: Thank you for having us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Up next, "Watters' World" has a Summit here in New York. Trump and Chairman Kim impersonators are going to explain what happened in Vietnam. Stick around.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Second Summit between President Trump and North Korean Leader Kim Jong-un ended abruptly Thursday after Trump walked away from the bad deal. But "Watters' World" wanted to continue the conversation. So we've asked both President Trump and Kim Jong-un to join us in this exclusive joint interview. Mr. President, I will begin with you. How is your relationship with Kim?

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, I do like Kim. I enjoy his company. But you know what? Yesterday it was time to walk away. There is a time in some negotiations, you just need to walk. Let him digest what we had.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So Kim, you know, the President just walked away from the table and wasn't happy with the deal. How did that make you feel?

utterances.speaker: KIM JONG-UN IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: I feel completely betrayed. I thought we had a deal. I mean, he told me how much he loved me and is in love with me.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: He wrote me beautiful letters and they're great letters. We fell in love.

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: And now, he just walks away like a lover after the first night out. I feel completely shattered.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, do you agree with that characterization?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, there is - we are developing quite a bond and yes, I suppose there is a little bit of love there. Sometimes lovers have spats. I walked away because he was unwilling to negotiate the way I wanted to.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So apparently, the deal broke down because the United States wants to keep the sanctions on, and Chairman Kim says he'll get rid of this big nuclear program, the main testing site. But he wants the sanctions off. And that's what the basis for the disagreement was, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: No, he's a liar.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Basically, yes, and --

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: The orange man is a liar. And he is - liar, liar pants on fire. We actually were only --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Don't call me that. You are the liar, little rocket man.

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: You're the liar, liar. We were actually just going to give up a little bit of what he wants and then he was supposed to give us just a little bit of relief on the sanctions.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, I gave you some stuff, you know, and you didn't really give me very much at all. And I was a little bit disappointed and upset.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Will there be a Third Summit?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: I hope so. I am open to it. Although I walked away, I was a little upset --

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Hey, I am open to it as well. I mean, it's best to talk than have a war, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now, would Dennis Rodman help things move along, Chairman Kim?

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Of course. We should organize a basketball match between the U.S.A. and North Korea, and yes, I think that would improve relations and maybe at the same time, they can send over Beyonce and perform in North Korea as well.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, Kim, are you going to play basketball?

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: And Katy Perry, and Katy Perry by the way. I love Katy Perry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, what did you say?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: I was wondering if Kim would like to play basketball, maybe a little one-on-one would be more appropriate.

utterances.speaker: KIM IMPERSONATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, hey, why not? I'm sure the world would love to see our fat asses on the court.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, well, this interview was a disaster - kind of like the actual Second Summit in Hanoi. But gentlemen, thank you very much. Up next. "Last Call."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Time now for "Last Call." An incredibly scary situation for a Utah skier after he got caught in an avalanche a few weeks ago. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They got him. That's all for tonight. Be sure to follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter and remember, I am Watters, and this is my world.
